results.title: Elephant theatre (K)
results.creator_credit: Sabrina Schmid and Swinburne Institute of Technology. Film and Television School
results.brief_description: One man has built a little theatre which he can hold in the palm of his hand. It reveals a world of its own. Yet there remains one dream to be fulfilled: that some elephants will come to live in it.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Sabrina Schmid and Swinburne Institute of Technology. Film and Television School

results.title: Elephant
results.creator_credit: Peter Chermayeff and Encyclopaedia Britannica Films
results.brief_description: Shows without commentary the African elephant on its daily routine of foraging, dusting, playing, roaming anddrinking from a waterhole. Illustrates the elephants physical characteristics. Suitable for primary school level.

results.title: Elements
results.brief_description: This program tracks the journey of Western Australia’s natural gas from the North Rankin “A” Gas and Condensate production platform, through its 134 km journey to the Burrup Peninsula and through the liquefication process, concluding with delivery to Japan. The video explains various elements of the LNG plant including the sulfinol column, dehydration unit, scrub column, heat exchanger, storage tanks and control room. The program concludes with details of the LNG ships and their delivery of LNG to Japanese power utilities.

results.title: Elegant girl or the drive for reliability
results.brief_description: A musical advertisement for the Vauxhall motor car. Makes a technical comparison between vintage and later model cars and shows the detailed testing the modern Vauxhall goes through to ensure its all-round quality and performance is at a maxiumum.

results.title: Electrostatic charges and forces
results.brief_description: This film shows how positive and negative charges are created: defines such basic concepts as insulator, conductor and electric field; and introduces Coulomb’s law, used to measure electrostatic charges. A laboratory demonstration of Faraday’s ice-pail experiment is presented. The film also shows how the principles of electrostatic charges and forces can be used to explain the operation of the Van de Graaff generator.

results.title: Electrochemistry (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Barrie Whatley, BBC-TV and Open University
results.brief_description: Teaches the basic concepts of electrochemical cells, starting with the question of how chemical reactions can be used to provide electricity using the displacement of silver from solution by copper

results.title: Electrochemistry
results.brief_description: The following phenomena are studied in this film: the electrolytic decomposition of hydrogen chloride; the production of an electric current; the functioning of a storage battery; electroplating and the function of the electrodes; electro-refining and the action of preferential discharge; the precipitation of a solvent; the production of aluminium from a molten electrolyte.

results.title: Electricity: The Story
results.brief_description: An animated film that features a character called “Electro”. Electro explains what electricity is, how it is generated, and the way it is transmitted from a power station to the home. The film outlines the uses and the safety aspects of electricity.
results.description: An animated film that features a character called “Electro”. Electro explains what electricity is, how it is generated, and the way it is transmitted from a power station to the home. The film outlines the uses and the safety aspects of electricity.

results.title: Einstein: the story of the man by his friends
results.brief_description: A biographical documentary dealing with the life and work of Albert Einstein using historical footage and interviews with friends and colleagues. The film explores Einstein’s childhood, education, work, migration and political beliefs. His theories are explained using simple, unscientific terms. Tragically, despite his pacifism, Einstein’s work was instrumental in the creation of the atomic bomb. Includes footage of Einstein with Charlie Chaplin, at a ceremony in his honour hosted by George Bernard Shaw, visiting California between the wars and receiving a Nobel prize. It also contains historical footage of the World Wars including the burning of books by the Nazi party and attacks on Jewish homes and businesses. Narrated by John Stockbridge. Photographed by Eugene Carr, Len Newson and Tony Leggo. Edited by Ted Walter.
